content: top row of shells tie in a bow trim ends sew large snap inside top of bag at front and back note you can change the width of this bag very easily by adding or subtracting chains in the foundation row work rounds of shells until the bag is the height you want the lining is optional as i found this yarn when used with a double strand to hold its shape well and it was easy to stitch on a sewing machine alternative strap with double strand chain 9 row 1 in 5th chain from hook work 4 double_crochet skip 2 chs work double_crochet chain 3 turn row 2 work 4 double_crochet in space between 2 middle double_crochet double_crochet in top of chain-3 chain 3 turn repeat row 2 until strap is desired length sew to end sides of bag you may also want to cut a piece of satin lining 1 wider than strap turn each side under ½ and stitch along underside of strap for reinforcement © 2006 by beverly button http //www buttonspecialties com
